page.title: 03Cranshaws House
page.content:
Cranshaws House is situated alongside ten cottages, eight of which are semi- detached while the other two are single homes. Near the cottages is a duck pond.
Cranshaws House has a swimming pool and big gardens. On the farm there are seven sheds. These are used as lambing sheds, for hay and straw storage, one with grain hoppers, for holding fleeces and for stabling riding horses. Roughly in the middle of the farm there is a medium sized castle (tower built in 1350).
The ruins of the old church lie 220 yards South, South West of the castle. Only part of the West wall remains within the churchyard.
